page.title: 08LANGUAGE
page.content: Lancashire has a strong dialect which dates back to man's first utterings. Hyndburn also has a variation on the Lancashire dialect all to itself. In Hyndburn most of the people speak English. There are other languages which are spoken, Urdu, Punjabi and Bengoli. Most of the Muslims in Hyndburn speak Punjabi. Muslims write right to left. Most of the English people think the Muslims are writing wrong but they are not because they have their own rules. Most local Muslims speak Punjabi though with a western dialect. Many Muslim children are speaking English with a Lancashire dialect and using the old Lancashire sayings. Here are some: "E's popped his clogs" means "He has died". "There's nowt queerer than folk" means "Everybody's different". Rhyddings High School
